content:
SqlDataSourceDesigner Class

In this Article

Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the SqlDataSource control.

Syntax

Declaration

public class SqlDataSourceDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ComponentDesigner
  • HtmlControlDesigner
  • ControlDesigner
  • System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner
  • SqlDataSourceDesigner

Constructors summary

SqlDataSourceDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the SqlDataSourceDesigner class.

Properties summary

CanConfigure

Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called by the design host.
CanRefreshSchema

Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called by the design host.
ConnectionString

Gets or sets the string used to open a database.
DeleteQuery

Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports delete queries.
InsertQuery

Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports insert queries.
ProviderName

Gets or sets the name of the .NET Framework data provider that the associated SqlDataSource control uses to connect to an underlying data source.
SelectCommand

Gets or sets the SQL query in the associated SqlDataSource for selecting data from the underlying database.
SelectQuery

Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports select queries.
UpdateQuery

Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports update queries.

Methods summary

Configure()

Launches the data source configuration utility in the design host.
CreateView(String)

Creates a new SqlDesignerDataSourceView instance using the specified name.
DeriveParameters(String,DbCommand)

Derives the parameters from the specified SQL command and adds corresponding Parameter objects to the command's parameters collection.
GetConnectionString()

Gets the connection string that is valid at design time for the control that is associated with this designer.
GetView(String)

Retrieves a DesignerDataSourceView object that is identified by the view name.
GetViewNames()

Gets a list of available views.
InferParameterNames(DesignerDataConnection,String,SqlDataSourceCommandType)

Returns an array of parameters using the specified connection, command text, and command type.
PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

Used by the designer to add properties to, or remove them from, the Properties grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.
RefreshSchema(Boolean)

Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.

Constructors

  • SqlDataSourceDesigner()

    Initializes a new instance of the SqlDataSourceDesigner class.

    public SqlDataSourceDesigner ();

Properties

  • CanConfigure

    Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called by the design host.

    public override bool CanConfigure { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the design host supports the IDataEnvironment interface; otherwise false.

  • CanRefreshSchema

    Gets a value indicating whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called by the design host.

    public override bool CanRefreshSchema { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.ConnectionString* and stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDataSourceDesigner.SelectCommand* properties are not empty; otherwise false.

  • ConnectionString

    Gets or sets the string used to open a database.

    public string ConnectionString { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string used to open a database connection at runtime.

    Remarks

    The ConnectionString property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • DeleteQuery

    Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports delete queries.

    public System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation DeleteQuery { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataSourceOperation

      The DataSourceOperation query.

    Remarks

    For this implementation, setting the DeleteQuery property has no effect. The DeleteQuery property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • InsertQuery

    Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports insert queries.

    public System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation InsertQuery { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataSourceOperation

      The DataSourceOperation query.

    Remarks

    For this implementation, setting the DeleteQuery property has no effect. The InsertQuery property in the designer shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • ProviderName

    Gets or sets the name of the .NET Framework data provider that the associated SqlDataSource control uses to connect to an underlying data source.

    public string ProviderName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string containing the name of the data provider.

    Remarks

    The ProviderName property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • SelectCommand

    Gets or sets the SQL query in the associated SqlDataSource for selecting data from the underlying database.

    public string SelectCommand { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      An SQL query.

    Remarks

    The SelectCommand property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • SelectQuery

    Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports select queries.

    public System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation SelectQuery { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataSourceOperation

      The DataSourceOperation query.

    Remarks

    For this implementation, setting the DeleteQuery property has no effect. The ProviderName property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

  • UpdateQuery

    Gets or sets the SqlDataSourceDesigner that supports update queries.

    public System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation UpdateQuery { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • DataSourceOperation

      The DataSourceOperation query.

    Remarks

    For this implementation, setting the DeleteQuery property has no effect. The UpdateQuery property shadows the same property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

Methods

  • Configure()

    Launches the data source configuration utility in the design host.

    public override void Configure ();
  • CreateView(String)

    Creates a new SqlDesignerDataSourceView instance using the specified name.

    protected virtual System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.SqlDesignerDataSourceView CreateView (string viewName);

    Parameters

    • viewName
      String

      The name of the view to create.

    Returns

    • SqlDesignerDataSourceView

      An SqlDesignerDataSourceView object.

    Remarks

    SqlDesignerDataSourceView
  • DeriveParameters(String,DbCommand)

    Derives the parameters from the specified SQL command and adds corresponding Parameter objects to the command's parameters collection.

    protected virtual void DeriveParameters (string providerName, System.Data.Common.DbCommand command);

    Parameters

    • providerName
      String

      The name of the data provider.

    • command
      DbCommand

      A DbCommand object.

  • GetConnectionString()

    Gets the connection string that is valid at design time for the control that is associated with this designer.

    protected virtual string GetConnectionString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A connection string.

  • GetView(String)

    Retrieves a DesignerDataSourceView object that is identified by the view name.

    public override System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView GetView (string viewName);

    Parameters

    • viewName
      String

      The name of the view to get.

    Returns

    • DesignerDataSourceView

      A DesignerDataSourceView object if found in the data source; otherwise null.

  • GetViewNames()

    Gets a list of available views.

    public override string[] GetViewNames ();

    Returns

    • String[]

      A string array containing the names of the available views.

  • InferParameterNames(DesignerDataConnection,String,SqlDataSourceCommandType)

    Returns an array of parameters using the specified connection, command text, and command type.

    protected virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter[] InferParameterNames (System.ComponentModel.Design.Data.DesignerDataConnection connection, string commandText, System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceCommandType commandType);

    Parameters

    • connection
      DesignerDataConnection

      A DesignerDataConnection object.

    • commandText
      String

      The text of the command.

    • commandType
      SqlDataSourceCommandType

      A SqlDataSourceCommandType indicating the type of command.

    Returns

    • Parameter[]

      An array of Parameter objects.

  • PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

    Used by the designer to add properties to, or remove them from, the Properties grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

    protected override void PreFilterProperties (System.Collections.IDictionary properties);

    Parameters

    • properties
      IDictionary

      The properties to be filtered.

  • RefreshSchema(Boolean)

    Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.

    public override void RefreshSchema (bool preferSilent);

    Parameters

    • preferSilent
      Boolean

      true to suppress all data source events until the schema is refreshed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The RefreshSchema method will be called by the design host only if CanRefreshSchema is true.
